middleware.name: BTSDK Shared Includes
middleware.desc:
This is a collection of BTSDK common header files used by all AIROC™ applications. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of all AIROC™ Chip Support Package (CSP) libraries.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-include
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: BTSDK Tools
middleware.desc:
This is a collection of BTSDK common tools used by all AIROC™ applications to generate embedded application images and program them to a board. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of all AIROC™ Chip Support Package (CSP) libraries.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-tools

middleware.name: BTSDK Utilities
middleware.desc:
This is a collection of BTSDK shared utilities usable for all AIROC™ applications. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of all AIROC™ Chip Support Package (CSP) libraries.

Utilities included:
  • BTSpy: Tracing utility to collect HCI and application traces, and Bluetooth® snoop logs.
  • wmbt: AIROC™ manufacturing Bluetooth® test tool (WMBT) is used to test and verify the RF performance of Infineon SoC Bluetooth® BR/EDR/LE devices
  • ecdsa256: Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm
To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-utils

middleware.name: BTSDK Host Apps for Bluetooth® Classic and Bluetooth® Low Energy
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the ClientControl app for Bluetooth® LE and BR/EDR embedded apps, and demonstrates use of the AIROC™ HCI protocol to control embedded apps. Binaries and source code are included.

The following BTSDK apps use ClientControl:
  • Audio: watch, audio_gateway
  • HID: ble_mouse, ble_keyboard, ble_remote
  • LE: anc, ans, hrc, hrs, bac, bas, le_coc
  • RFCOMM: pbap_client, map_client, opp_server
Any embedded app that configures traces over AIROC™ HCI would also need to use the ClientControl app to view traces in the BTSpy utility.

Supported OS: Windows, Linux, and Android.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-host-apps-bt-ble

middleware.name: BTSDK Host and Peer Apps for Mesh
middleware.desc:
This repo contains host and peer apps to be used with embedded Mesh apps. Host apps act as an MCU to demonstrate use of the AIROC™ HCI protocol to control embedded apps. Peer apps demonstrate Mesh configuration and provisioning from other peer Mesh devices. Binaries and source code are included.

Repo contents:
  • host/VS_ClientControl: Host MCU app that can provision and control an embedded Mesh app. It provides a UI to control all Mesh models. Supported OS: Windows.
  • host/QT_ClientControl: Host MCU app that can provision and control an embedded Mesh app for the Mesh Lighting Model. Supported OS: Windows, Linux, and macOS.
  • peer/: Peer Mesh device app that demonstrates Mesh configuration and provisioning of an embedded app from a peer device. Supported OS: Android, iOS, WatchOS, and Windows.
  • mesh_client_lib/: Mesh client support library used by both host and peer apps.
To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-host-peer-apps-mesh

middleware.name: BTSDK Peer Apps for LE
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the HelloClient app for use with Bluetooth® Low Energy (LE) embedded apps, specifically the Hello Sensor embedded BTSDK app. Together they demonstrate LE Vendor Specific Device communication. Binaries and source code are included.

Supported OS: Android and Windows

The Hello Sensor embedded app can be found here:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ble-hello-sensor
To browse the HelloClient app repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-peer-apps-ble

middleware.name: BTSDK Peer Apps for OTA
middleware.desc:
This repo contains peer apps to be used with the Bluetooth® Over-the-Air Firmware Upgrade embedded application. Together they demonstrate upgrading an embedded application's firmware over Bluetooth®. Binaries and source code are included.

Separate apps are supplied for Android, iOS, and Windows

The OTA Firmware Upgrade BTSDK embedded application can be found here:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ota-firmware-upgrade
To browse the peer app repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-peer-apps-ota

middleware.name: CYW20706A2
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW20706A2 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/20706A2

middleware.name: CYW20819A1
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW20819A1 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/20819A1

middleware.name: CYW20820A1
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW20820A1 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/20820A1

middleware.name: CYW43012C0
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW43012C0 wireless MCU Wi-Fi + Bluetooth® combo device supporting LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/43012C0

middleware.name: CYW43022C1
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW43022C1 wireless MCU Wi-Fi + Bluetooth® combo device supporting LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/43022C1

middleware.name: CYW20719B2
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW20719B2 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/20719B2

middleware.name: CYW20721B2
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW20721B2 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/20721B2

middleware.name: CYW30739A0
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW30739A0 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/30739A0

middleware.name: CYW55572A1
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW55572A1 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® LE/BR/EDR. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/55572A1

middleware.name: CYW20736A1
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW20736A1 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® BR and LE. EDR is not supported. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/20736A1

middleware.name: CYW20835B1
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the Chip Support Package (CSP) library for the Infineon CYW20835B1 wireless MCU device supporting Bluetooth® LE. BR/EDR is not supported. The library contains the base startup code and header files necessary to build for the target device. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of the selected board.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/20835B1

middleware.name: BTSDK Shared Source
middleware.desc:
This repo contains a collection of common utility functions usable by all AIROC™ applications. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of every board's associated Chip Support Package.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-common

middleware.name: Audio
middleware.desc:
This repo contains a collection of AIROC™ audio-related libraries. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of BTSDK applications that require one or more of the libraries.

Each library is found under a COMPONENT_(folder_name) folder in the btsdk-audio repo, see the library list below for the folder names for each library. To use the libraries in an application, add the folder name to the COMPONENTS variable in the application makefile. For example, to use the Hands-free Profile library, add the following to the application makefile:
COMPONENTS+=handsfree_profile

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-audio
To see an application using these libraries:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-audio-watch
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

version.desc:
4.5.1 release

Libraries included:
  • AVRC Controller Profile (avrc_controller)
  • AVRC Target Profile (avrc_target)
  • Hands-free Profile (handsfree_profile)
  • Audio Gateway Profile (hfp_audio_gateway)
  • Audio Sink Profile (a2dp_sink_profile)
  • Apple Media Service (ams)
  • Apple Notification Center Service (ancs)
  • Audio Insert Funtionality (audio_insert_lib)
  • Audio Manager (audiomanager)
  • Headset/Speaker Support (bt_hs_spk_lib)
  • AK4679 Codec Support (codec_ak4679_lib)
  • CYW9BT Audio Support (cyw9bt_audio and cyw9bt_audio2)
  • CS47l35 Codec Support (codec_cs47l35_lib)
  • Audio Record Support (audio_record_lib)
  • AIROC™ HCI Control Of Audio Streaming (audio_uart)

middleware.name: Bluetooth® Low Energy
middleware.desc:
This repo contains a collection of AIROC™ Bluetooth® Low Energy Profile libraries. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of BTSDK applications that require one or more of the libraries.

Each library is found under a COMPONENT_(folder_name) folder in the btsdk-ble repo, see the library list below for the folder names for each library. To use the libraries in an application, add the folder name to the COMPONENTS variable in the application makefile. For example, to use the Alert Notification Client library, add the following to the application makefile:
COMPONENTS+=anc_lib

Libraries included:
  • Alert Notification Client (anc_lib)
  • Alert Notification Server (ans_lib)
  • Battery Service Client (bat_client_lib)
  • Beacon support for both iBeacon and Eddystone (beacon_lib)
  • Heart Rate Client (hrc_lib)
  • Heart Rate Server (hrs_lib)
  • LE GATT Utilities (gatt_utils_lib)
To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-ble
To see an application using these libraries:
Alert Notification Client and LE GATT Utilities:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ble-alert-client
Alert Notification Server:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ble-alert-server
Battery Service Client:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ble-battery-client
Beacon:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ble-beacon
Heart Rate Client:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ble-heart-rate-client
Heart Rate Server:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ble-heart-rate-server
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: Human Interface Device
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the AIROC™ Bluetooth® Human Interface Device (HID) Profile library. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of BTSDK applications that require require it.

To use the library in an application, add the following to the application makefile:
COMPONENTS+=hidd_lib2

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-hid
To see an application using this library:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-hid-dual-mode-keyboard
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: Google Fast Pairing Service
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the AIROC™ Google Fast Pairing Service (GFPS) support library for applications that want to use GFPS. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of BTSDK applications that require require it.

To use the library in an application, add the following to the application makefile:
COMPONENTS+=gfps_provider

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-gfps
To see an application using this library:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-hid-dual-mode-keyboard
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: Mesh
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the AIROC™ Mesh Application library support for applications using Bluetooth® Mesh. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of all BTSDK Mesh applications.

To use the library in an application, add the following to the application makefile:
COMPONENTS+=mesh_app_lib

Note, this application bundles together all common application initialization functions to allow the Mesh application support to function as intended. As such, it not supported to add this library to an application based on a non-Mesh BTSDK application: It can only be supported in applications based on one of the BTSDK example Mesh applications, as non-Mesh applications perform the common initializations separately.

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-mesh
To see an application using this library:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-mesh-demo-color-light
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: Firmware Upgrade
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the AIROC™ Over-The-Air (OTA) Firmware Upgrade library to support OTA Firware upgrades. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of any BTSDK applications that use OTA.

To use the library in an application, add the following to the application makefile:
COMPONENTS+=mesh_app_lib
OTA_FW_UPGRADE?=1

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-ota
To see an application using this library:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-ota-firmware-upgrade
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: RFCOMM
middleware.desc:
This repo contains a collection of AIROC™ Bluetooth® RFCOMM Profile libraries. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of BTSDK applications that require one or more of the libraries.

Each library is found under a COMPONENT_(folder_name) folder in the btsdk-rfcomm repo, see the library list below for the folder names for each library. To use the libraries in an application, add the folder name to the COMPONENTS variable in the application makefile. For example, to use the Message Access Profile library, add the following to the application makefile:
COMPONENTS+=map_lib

Libraries included:
  • Message Access Profile (map_lib)
  • Phone Book Access Profile (pbap_lib)
  • Serial Port Profile (spp_lib)
  • Object Push Profile (opp_lib)
  • Object Exchange Protocol (obex_lib)
To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-rfcomm
To see an application using these libraries:
Message Access Profile and Object Exchange Profile:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-rfcomm-map-client
Phone Book Access Profile:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-rfcomm-pbap-client
Serial Port Profile:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-rfcomm-spp
Object Push Profile:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-rfcomm-opp-server
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: PAN
middleware.desc:
This repo contains the AIROC™ Bluetooth® PAN Profile library. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of BTSDK applications that may require it.

The library is found under the COMPONENT_pan_lib folder in the btsdk-pan repo. To use the library in an application, add the folder name to the COMPONENTS variable in the application makefile. For example:
COMPONENTS+=pan_lib

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-pan
To see an application using the library:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-audio-watch
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: Drivers
middleware.desc:
This repo contains a collection of AIROC™ Driver support libraries. It is downloaded automatically as a dependency of BTSDK applications that require one or more of the libraries.

Each library is found under a COMPONENT_(folder_name) folder in the btsdk-drivers repo, see the library list below for the folder names for each library. To use the libraries in an application, add the folder name to the COMPONENTS variable in the application makefile. For example, to use the Ambient Light Sensor library, add the following to the application makefile:
COMPONENTS+=ambient_light_sensor_lib

Libraries included:
  • Library to convert HSL Color to RGB Color values (hsl_rgb_lib)
  • Library providing API implementation for NCP15XV103E03RC thermistor (thermistor_ncp15xv103_lib)
  • Library providing API implementation for NCU15WF104F60RC thermistor (thermistor_ncu15wf104_lib)
  • ALS (Ambient Light Sensor) library for MAX44009 ALS (ambient_light_sensor_lib)
  • PIR (Passive Infrared Motion Sensor) library for e93196 motion sensor (pir_motion_sensor_lib)
  • Button Management Support (button_manager)
  • LED Management Support (led_manager)
To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/btsdk-rfcomm
To see an application using these libraries:
HSL to RGB:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-mesh-demo-color-light
Thermistors:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-mesh-demo-sensor-temperature
ALS:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-hal-i2c-master
PIR:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-mesh-demo-sensor-motion
Button Management:
https://github.com/Infineon/mtb-example-btsdk-audio-headset-speaker
For API documentation, see:
https://infineon.github.io/btsdk-docs/BT-SDK/index.html

middleware.name: LE Audio Profiles Library
middleware.desc:
This is a collection of all the LE Audio profiles (CAP, BAP, ASCS, PACS, VCS, VCP, MCS, MCP, TBS, CCP)

To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/le-audio-profiles

middleware.name: LE GATT Interface
middleware.desc:
Definitions for interface between Bluetooth® LE stack GATT and service/application. The GATT interface is responsible for routing the incoming GATT commands to the appropriate service/services or application. This library provides support for applications to:
  • Discover remote services, included services, characteristics and descriptors, and map them to the registered service implementations
  • Setup local services, included services, characteristics and descriptors, and map them to the registered service implementations
  • Perform basic operations such as configuring notifications, notifying remote clients or reading characteristics
  • Organize non-volatile data for storing and reading back from NVRAM
To browse the repo, see:
https://github.com/Infineon/gatt-interface
